identificationModule.briefTitle: Assessment of Serum Levels of Adenosine Deaminase and Immunoglobulin E in Patients With Chronic Spontaneous Urticaria
identificationModule.officialTitle: Assessment of Serum Levels of Adenosine Deaminase and Immunoglobulin E in Patients With Chronic Spontaneous Urticaria

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Resident physician at Dermatology department, Sohag University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: adenosine deaminase activity (ADA) has been reported to be elevated in various diseases such as psoriasis, acne and juvenile idiopathic arthritis. There is no previous studies that assessed ADA in chronic spontaneous urticaria (CSU) .

armGroups.label: CSU group
armGroups.description: Adult patients complaining of chronic spontaneous urticaria (CSU)
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Adenosine deaminase serum level
Diagnostic Test: IgE antibodies serum level

armGroups.label: Control group
armGroups.description: A group of age and sex-matched healthy controls (blood donors).
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Adenosine deaminase serum level
Diagnostic Test: IgE antibodies serum level

interventions.name: Adenosine deaminase serum level
interventions.description: Adenosine deaminase will be measured by enzymatic (clorometric / kinetic) method (Diazyme laboratories, San Diego, California, USA).

interventions.name: IgE antibodies serum level
interventions.description: Level of IgE will be measured by electrochemiluminesence immunoassay (ECLIA, automatic cobase immunoassay, Roche Diagnostics GmbH, Mannheim, USA).

primaryOutcomes.description: Difference in serum level of adenosine deaminase between CSU group and control group
Difference in serum level of IgE between CSU group and control group

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* adult patients complaining of CSU and a group of age and sex-matched healthy controls (blood donors).

Exclusion Criteria:

* Pregnancy and lactation.
* Patients with systemic diseases, especially those with autoimmune diseases and infections.
* Patients with skin diseases.
* Patients on medications such as antibiotics, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, anticonvulsants, penicillin, and combined oral contraceptives.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation:
Settings: Dermatology outpatient clinics and Central Research Lab at Sohag University.

Study population: The study will include adult patients complaining of CSU and a group of age and sex-matched healthy controls (blood donors).

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: IPD will be shared upon request to the study director
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Data will become available after study due for unlimited period of time.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: IPD will be shared upon request by the study director. Patients' names will be anonymous.
